docs.text: Overview About the app Kanjiclub is an open-source cloud app for vocabulary training. Go to kanjiclub.tk to try it out for yourself. Web API All pages that end with "API" document REST API endpoints. HTTP requests will be formatted like this: Formatting Endpoint name Optional description METHOD /endpoint/url optional request body optional response body Generic responses A generic response is an HTTP response without a body. The status of the reply should be in the HTTP status code. Generic responses are omitted from the docs. Endpoints /api/accounts /api/stats /api/languages /api/lessons /api/words /api/practice
docs.title: Overview

docs.text: Accounts API Create account POST /api/accounts/new { "email": "", "username": "", "password": "" } Log in POST /api/accounts/login { "user": "", "password": "" } Get settings GET /api/accounts/me { "currentLanguage": "", "practiceOptions": PracticeOptions } Change settings PUT /api/accounts/me { "currentLanguage": "", "practiceOptions": PracticeOptions }
docs.title: Accounts API

docs.text: Languages API Languages are identified by their language code, which is a 2-letter ISO code ( ISO-639-1 ) Add new language POST /api/languages/new { "languageCode": "" } Get list of languages GET /api/languages { "languages": [] }
docs.title: Languages API

docs.text: Languages are identified by their language code, which is a 2-letter ISO code ( ISO-639-1 )
docs.title: Languages API

docs.text: Lessons API Lessons are identified using the UUID generated by the server. A lesson always belongs to a language. Get lessons GET /api/lessons/{languageCode} { "lessons": [ LessonInfo ] } Create lesson POST /api/lessons/{languageCode}/new { "name": "" } { "id": "" } Rename lesson PUT /api/lessons/{languageCode}/{lessonId} { "name": "" } Delete lesson DELETE /api/lessons/{languageCode}/{lessonId} Import vocabulary POST /api/lessons/{languageCode}/{lessonId}/import POST body should be raw binary data of the imported file.
docs.title: Lessons API

docs.text: Lessons are identified using the UUID generated by the server. A lesson always belongs to a language.
docs.title: Lessons API

docs.text: POST /api/lessons/{languageCode}/{lessonId}/import POST body should be raw binary data of the imported file.
docs.title: Import vocabulary

docs.text: API objects LessonInfo { "id": "", "name": "", "createdOn": "", "language": "" } WordInfo { "id": "", "lesson": "", "language": "", "createdOn": "", "lastPracticed": "", "strength": "weak", "data": { "foreign": "", "synonym": "", "gender": "", "native": "", "comment": "" } } WordStrength weak medium strong PracticeOptions { "includeSynonyms": true, "randomizeDir": true, "ignoreCase": true }
docs.title: API objects

docs.text: Practice API The practice API is used to generate a new test for the user. Practices are not persisted to the database, only their results. Generate new practice POST /api/practice/{languageCode}/new { "target": "lesson", "lessons": [ lessonId ] } OR { "target": "word_group", "strength": "weak" } { "words": [ WordInfo ] } Practice completed POST /api/practice/{languageCode}/complete { "words": [ { "wordId": "", "correct": false } ] }
docs.title: Practice API

docs.text: The practice API is used to generate a new test for the user. Practices are not persisted to the database, only their results.
docs.title: Practice API

docs.text: Stats API The stats API is used to fetch statistical information about the users learning progress. Stats summary GET /api/stats { "streak": 0, "strong": 0, "medium": 0, "weak": 0 }
docs.title: Stats API

docs.text: The stats API is used to fetch statistical information about the users learning progress.
docs.title: Stats API

docs.text: Words API Words are identified using their randomly generated word id Fetch words To get all words in a lesson, omit strength , and to get all words with a specific strength, omit lesson . GET /api/words?strength={wordStrength}&lesson={lessonId} { "words": [ WordInfo ] } Create word POST /api/words/new { WordInfo } { "id": "" } Update word PUT /api/words/{wordId} { WordInfo } Delete word DELETE /api/words/{wordId}
docs.title: Words API

docs.text: Words are identified using their randomly generated word id
docs.title: Words API
